elements.title: Olga Lander (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olga Lander's camera required her to work close to the dangerous wartime subjects she photographed (example pictured)?

elements.title: Boroline (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the antiseptic cream Boroline was marketed to appeal to nationalistic sentiments?

elements.title: King Christian IX and Queen Louise of Denmark were the parents (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that King Christian IX and Queen Louise of Denmark were the parents of a Danish king, a British queen, a Greek king, and a Russian empress?

elements.title: an $8,000 "antique" (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John D. Rockefeller Jr., under the name "David's Father", secretly authorized the purchase of an $8,000 "antique"?

elements.title: Evgeniia Subbotina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although Evgeniia Subbotina failed to escape her own exile in Siberia, she successfully aided the escapes of Catherine Breshkovsky, Yelizaveta Kovalskaya and Sofya Bogomolets?

elements.title: an 18th-century hymn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an 18th-century hymn inspired the title of George W. Bush's 1999 autobiography?

elements.title: I Gusti Ngurah Jaya Negara (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Denpasar mayor I Gusti Ngurah Jaya Negara became active in politics after he was laid off from a bank due to the Asian financial crisis?

elements.title: destruction of trees and farmland in Gaza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Israel's destruction of trees and farmland in Gaza has been described as an ecocide?

elements.title: Elizabeth Storie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Elizabeth Storie's doctor poured nitric acid into her mouth, causing her teeth to fall out?
